title: Eutelsat orders 340 additional satellites to replenish OneWeb constellation
summary:
Eutelsat has ordered the remaining 340 satellites needed to replenish its OneWeb satellite constellation from Airbus Defence and Space.
The post Eutelsat orders 340 additional satellites to replenish OneWeb constellation appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA’s Webb Delivers Unprecedented Look Into Heart of Circinus Galaxy
summary: The Circinus Galaxy, a galaxy about 13 million light-years away, contains an active supermassive black hole that continues to influence its evolution. The largest source of infrared light from the region closest to the black hole itself was thought to be outflows, or streams of superheated matter that fire outward.  Image: Circinus Galaxy (Hubble and […]

title: Aerospacelab to build eight satellites for Xona’s navigation constellation
summary:
Belgian manufacturer to support early rollout as U.S. commercial PNT startup builds in-house production
The post Aerospacelab to build eight satellites for Xona’s navigation constellation appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: ATD water-cooled throttleable engine firing
summary: Romanian company ATD Aerospace RS SRL is developing a 10 kN rocket engine that can be re-ignited and adjust its thrust. This builds on the 1 kN engine they developed with support from the European Space Agency (ESA).

title: A Plume of Bright Blue in Melissa’s Wake
summary: The category 5 hurricane stirred up carbonate sediment near Jamaica in what scientists believe is the largest such event in the satellite record.

title: Artemis Accords Reach Another Milestone with Portugal
summary: Portugal became the 60th country to join the Artemis Accords today. It’s another milestone for the U.S.-led principles for responsible behavior on the Moon. The Accords recently celebrated the fifth […]

title: ISS gains new commander as Crew-11 prepares midweek departure
summary: NASA astronaut Mike Fincke took over command of the International Space Station on Dec. 7, 2025. He and the rest of the SpaceX Crew-11 mission will undock from the ISS on Jan. 14.

title: Portugal signs the Artemis Accords
summary:
Portugal has become the latest country to sign the Artemis Accords outlining best practices for responsible space exploration, beating out another European country to be the 60th to join.
The post Portugal signs the Artemis Accords appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA, SpaceX Invite Media to Watch Crew-12 Launch to Space Station
summary: Media accreditation is open for the launch of NASA’s 12th rotational mission of a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket and Dragon spacecraft carrying astronauts to the International Space Station for a science expedition from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.
